task.name: caltabconvert
task.shortdescription: Convert old-style caltables into new-style caltables.
task.description: This task converts old-style (up to CASA 3.3.0) caltables into new-style (CASA 3.4.0 and later) caltables. It is provided as a convenience and is strictly temporary. The information transferred should be enough for most calibration purposes. BPOLY and GSPLINE versions are not supported. Only simple bugs will be fixed. If there are other issues, it is suggested that a new-style caltable be created directly.

param.name: caltabold
param.description:
Name of the old-style caltable. Default: none
Example: caltabold='gronk.g0'

param.name: vis
param.shortdescription: Name of the visibility file (MS) associated with the old-style caltable.
param.description:
Name of the visibility file (MS) associated with the old-style caltable. Default: none
Example: 'blurp.ms'

param.name: ptype
param.shortdescription: Type of data in the new-format caltable ("complex" or "float"; default is "complex").
param.description:
Type of data in the new-format caltable. Default: "complex" Options: "complex" or "float"
Note: The old-style caltables do not have this information, so it is imperative that users get it correct. "complex" refers to caltables that have complex gains (e.g., produced by gaincal, bpcal, etc.). "float" refers to caltables that real numbers such as delays (e.g., produced by gencal).

param.name: caltabnew
param.shortdescription: Name of the new-style caltable. If not specified, the suffix ".new" is appended to the name of old-style caltable.
param.description: Name of the new-style caltable. Default: '' (the suffix ".new" is appended to the name of old-style caltable)
